intro: Prestonia goudotiana, commonly known as the Goudot's prestonia, is a climbing plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
